messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/27/2003 11:55:25 PM Eastern Standard Time, stephc62@bellsouth.net writes: Maybe the bobbin is in backwards?  This was happening to me and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/27/2003 11:55:25 PM Eastern Standard Time,
stephc62@... writes:
Maybe the bobbin is in backwards? This was happening to me and I just tried
it one more time with my friend sitting there. I turned the bobbin around and
it worked! Stepheny
Yeppa, It was. I love this group!

Thank you for answering my semi OT question.

Laura D

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing
messages.msgSnippet: This is what we think it was.  I have put these in many times and somehow I was doing
messages.messageBody:
<<<SandraDodd@... writes:
bobbin might be in backwards/upsidedown>>>

This is what we think it was. I have put these in many times and somehow I
was doing it wrong each time. Dah....
Thank you, Thank you , Thank you Sandra for your help. ; )

This is our first Satin dress so hopefully it turns out suitable for the
wedding. If all goes well I just might make mine also. (I dislike wearing
dresses! But i will for Mom)

Laura D and 3yr old Cassidy who is ready to make this dress.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing
messages.msgSnippet: Maybe the bobbin is in backwards?  This was happening to me and I just tried it one more time with my friend sitting there.  I turned the bobbin around and it
messages.messageBody:
Maybe the bobbin is in backwards? This was happening to me and I just tried it one more time with my friend sitting there. I turned the bobbin around and it worked! Stepheny
----- Original Message -----
From: HMSL2@...
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, July 27, 2003 10:05 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing


This may be a bit ot but being that we are making a dress with 3yr old
assistance and 11 yr old wants to make rug bear I need some help.

My sewing machine is jamming. The needle goes down and the bobbin area is
jamming. It goes around once and then it gets wrapped up under there. I checked
the needle is not in backwards and all looks/appears ok. Anyone know what may
be going on?

My little girl and I are making her a dress for my Mom's wedding. I need to
make this I promised we would do it together.

Help or suggestions would be great...

Laura D

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/27/2003 8:07:04 PM Mountain Daylight Time, HMSL2@aol.com ... What you might have already totally done, but I would try: Needle might be
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/27/2003 8:07:04 PM Mountain Daylight Time, HMSL2@...
writes:

> The needle goes down and the bobbin area is
> jamming. It goes around once and then it gets wrapped up under there. I
> checked
> the needle is not in backwards and all looks/appears ok. Anyone know what
> may
> be going on?
>

What you might have already totally done, but I would try:

Needle might be bent a little.

Bobbin tension might be too tight (there might be a screw you could loosen
just a little, 1/4 turn on mine)

bobbin might be in backwards/upsidedown

Try a different bobbin (in case this one is just too tight or tangled or
something)

clean out the bobbin area totally for extra thread or lint or stickiness

I would try rethreading everything, and try with different thread and bobbin.
The maybe try changing the needle.

I hope it's something easy.

Sandra



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] OT sewing
messages.msgSnippet: Sounds like your bobbin may be in wrong.  Take it out make sure the thread is coming from the right direction and put it back in.  I would change my needle for
messages.messageBody:
Sounds like your bobbin may be in wrong. Take it out make sure the thread
is coming from the right direction and put it back in. I would change my
needle for good measure because it could be bent a little.

HTH
Lisa
-----Original Message-----
